div.head: An humble Adoration to our Blessed Lord Iesus in the Holie Sacrament of his precious Body.
div.p:
O My most glorious Lord God and Sauiour Christ Iesus, true God, and true Man; most Holy, worthy, pure and precious Sacrifice of the most high God; liuing bread, and source of Eternall life; with all my hart,
Soule, forces and affections, I humbly worship, and adore thy Souraigne Majesty, in this diuine Sacrament, with a most earnest desire and intention, to repaire, if I could possible, all the Irreverences, Prophanations, dishonours, and impietyes, that haue beene committed against Thee, in this dreadfull Mystery, most humbly prostrating my selfe before thy Sacred Majesty, heere present, to adore thee, in supply, for all those that neuer haue; nor paraduenture euer shall be so happy, as to honour, worship and adore Thee; such as are all Heritikes, Atheists, Blasphemers, Magitiās, Iewes, Turkes, Idolaters, and all Infidels, wishing with all my hart that I alone could as much honour, prayse, glorify, and adore
Thee, as they altogether would haue done, if they had known and faithfully serued thee for all Eternity; and furthermore, from the bottome of my Heart, and with the most feruent affections of my Soule, I desire to render thy Divine Majesty as many adorations, prayses, and benedictions, as all the Diuells, and Damned Soules, will vtter blasphemyes for euer against Thee; and to Sanctify this adoration, and make it more pleasing to thy Sacred Majesty; I humbly vnite it to all those adorations, feruent affections, and prayses of the Triumphant, and Militant Church, and all that the glorious Virgin Mother, and all thy Holy Angels and Saints haue done, doe, and ever shall render vnto Thee, our most gracious, glorious,
deare, sweet, and Souraigne Lord, Eternally. Amen.

div.head: A deuout Salutation to our Blessed Sauiour in the Holy Sacrament.
div.p:
ALl hayle most sweet Lord Iesus Christ, eternall Word and vvisdome of the Father, Sonne of the Blessed Virgin, Lambe of God, Sauiour of the World; Sacred Host; the Word
made flesh; fountaine of Pitty.
All hayle most sweet Lord Iesus Christ; prayse of Angells; glory of Saints; Vision of peace, Entire Deity, true Man, Flower and Fruite of the Blessed Virgin Mother.
All hayle most sweet Lord Iesus Christ; Splendor of thy Father, Prince of Peace, Gate of heauen, liuing bread, Child of the Virgin, Vessel of the Deity.
All hayle most sweet Lord Iesus Christ; light of heauen; Price of the World; our true Ioy, Bread of Angells, Iubily of hearts, King and Spouse of Virginity.
All hayle most sweet Lord Iesus Christ, sweet Way, Supreame Verity, our Eternall reward, true Charity. Fountaine of Loue, peace, Sweetnes and life Euerlasting.

All hayle most holy, most sweet, most sacred, and most precious body of Christ Iesus: which layd vpon the Aultar of the Crosse for the Worlds Saluation, I beleiue with my hart, and confesse with my mouth, to be a true host, a holy, pure, and Immaculate Host and most pleasing to God; the bread of Eternall life; and Chalice of perpetuall Saluation, I adore thee in Spirit and truth O pious Iesu, O sweet Iesu; ô good and gracious Lord Iesus, be mercifull to mee I beseech Thee; and graciously grant, O my God, that as I see Thee heere in the forme of bread; so I may happily see Thee in Majesty and glory securely, and Ioyfully, for Euer and Euer. Amen.

div.head: Praysed be the Most Holie SACRAMENT.
div.p:
With as manie praises, as there be starres in Heauen; sparks in the fire; drops of water in the sea; moths of dust vpon the Earth; Flowers in the spring; graines of
corne in Sommer; leaues, in Automne; flocks of snow, or haile in winter; of corporall creatures, in the whole world.
For, thou art worthie of it: O Lord, of the whole vniuers. 2. Mach. 24.
Who being wrapped vp, vnder the species of Bread, and wine, Art truly, a God hidden, Isa. 45.

div.head: Praised be the Most Holie SACRAMENT.
div.p: With as many praises, as, by anie externall worke can be giuen, or pronounced by the mouth, and, as ëuer could, or heerafter can be conceaued, by the hearts of all humane creatures, that euer were, or shal be.
For, thou art worthie of it: O Lord, our Father. Isa. 63.
Who dost feede, and nourish vs daily, with thy precious Bodie; and thy precious Blould, which is, as it were, of a Lamb, without spott. 1. Pet. 1.

div.head: Praised be the Most Holie SACRAMENT.
div.p: With as manie praises, as all the Angels, yea the most Blessed Trinitie it self, can produce, by its Omnipotencie; wish, by its wisdome; wish, by its Goodnes; in euerie; at all times; euerie way; and for all Eternitie; and longer.

For, thou art worthie of it: O Lord,
my God. Isa. 25.
Who dost giue me, not only thy Humanitie, but thy Diuinitie also.
My Lord, and my God. 10.20.
The Lamb, which was killed is worthie, to take power, and Diuinitie and wisdome, and fortitude, and honour, and glorie, and benediction. Apoc. 5.
NOTE, That this Praise of the most Holie Sacrament, is fitting at all times; but especially before, and after Communion; and whilst Masse is saying.

div.head: PLENARIE INDULGENCES
Granted to all persons, by Pope Paul the V. at the instance of the Catholick King Philip III. 20. Dec. 1614.
div.p: PLenarie Indulgence, for all those, who shall, in some apparent place of their houses, haue these words: Praised be the most Holie Sacrament.

Item, Plenarie Indulgence, as often as one shall reade the said words; And, to him
or her, that cannot reade, and shall, in steed thereof, doe reuerence, to the Picture, or Paper, wherein these words are written, or printed.
Item, Plenarie Indulgence to those, who shall weare a Picture, or Medall, about them, wherein the said words shall be written, printed, or stampt.
Item, Plenarie Indulgence, as often as anie, after Confession, and Communion, shall say: Praised be the most Holie Sacrament. And, for the 5. first times, may deliuer 5. soules out of Purgatorie.

Item, Plenarie Indulgence, to euerie Christian soule, who, at the hower of death, hauing the Figure of the B. Sacrament▪ in their hands, shall say with deuotion: Praised be the most Holie Sacrament; or, saying
them with the heart, if they be not able to pronounce them with the mouth.

All this is according to the Copie approued, and printed more at large, in the yeares 1634. and 1635. by the widdow of Henrie Hastens, at Louaine. The Copies printed at Lyons say, that these Indulgences are confirmed by Pope Vrban the VIII. in the yeare 1624.
Hanc Laudem cum iunctis Indulgentiis admodum laudo, & censeo dignissimam praelo. 3. Iulij 1635.

div.head: A PRAYER TO the Sacred Wounds of our Blessed Sauiour.
div.p:
ETernall honour, glory, prayse, and thansgiuing, be to thee ô most sweet Lord IESUS Christ, for the Sacred vvound of thy right hand; by vvhich most precious wound I beseech the to forgiue mee all the Sinnes that euer I haue commited against thee by my fiue Senses; and all that euer I haue offended thee by thought, vvord, or
vvorke, in neglect of thy seruice; or vnlawfull delectation; sleeping▪ or waking; willingly or ignorantly; and by thy V • nerable Passion graciously grant thaA • I may vvorthylie call to minde thy dolourous and Sacred vvounds; and by mortification of my body shew my selfe gratfull to theem. Amen.

div.head: The second Prayer.
div.p:
ETernall honour, glory, prayse, and thansgiuing be to thee ô most sweet Lord IESUS Christ, for the Sacred vvound of thy left hand; by vvhich most precious Wound I beseech thee to haue mercy vpon mee; and to change in mee whatsoeuer is displeasing to thy divine Maiesty; and guie mee Victory ouer
my most vvicked Enimyes, that by thy power I may be able to ouercome them; and by thy most bitter death and Passion deliuer mee from all dangers and miseryes, both of this present life, and the future; and make mee vvorthy of thy grace in thy heauenly Kingdome. Amen.

div.head: The third Prayer.
div.p:
ETernall honour, glory, prayse, and thansgiuing bee to thee ô most sweet Lord IESUS Christ, for the Sacred wound of thy right Foote; by which precious Wound, grant that I may doe vvorthy pennance for my Sinnes; and by thy pious and dolourous death, giue mee grace, day and night, continually to doe thy vvill; and mercifully
vouchsafe to preserue and draw mee, thy poore vnworthy Seruant, out of all dangers of my Soule and Body; and at the hower of my death be pleased to receiue my Soule into the handes of thy mercy; and admit it into thy Eternall glory. Amen.

div.head: The fourth Prayer.
div.p:
ETernall honour, glory, prayse, and thansgiuing be to thee ô sweetest Lord IESUS; for the Sacred Wound of thy left foote; by which precious woūd I beseech thee, ô most mercifull Lord, to forgiue mee all the offēces that euer I haue cōmitted against thee; and graunt mee a plenary pardon and remission of all my Sinnes; that thou soucouring
mee I may escape the Iudgment of revenge; and I beseech thee ô most mercifull Lord IESUS, by thy most holy death, that before the day of my departure out of this World, I may obtaine the grace worthylie to receiue the Diuine Sacrament of thy most precious Body; and with true Contrition, and Confession of all my Sinnes; perfect pennance for them; with purity of minde and body; and the Sacrament of holy Vnction, to attaine to Eternall Saluation. Amen.

div.head: The fifth Prayer.
div.p:
ETernall honour, glory, prayse, and thansgiuing be to thee ô most beautifull Lord IESUS, for the holy wound of thy Sacred Side; by
which most precious Wound, and thy superaboundant mercy which thou hast shewed vs in the opening of thy sacred Side, I beseech thee ô most sweet Lord IESUS, that as by Baptisme thou hast clensed mee from originall Sinne; so by thy most precious blood, which is offred vp in Sacrifice for all the World; thou wilt be pleased to deliuer mee from all Euills, past, present and to come; and by thy most doulourous death graciously giue mee a right faith; firme hope; and perfect charity; that I may loue thee with my whole hart, with my whole Soule; and with all my forces and affections; confirme mee ô dearest Lord in all good workes, and giue mee a constant perseverance in thy holy service, to the end that I may
perfectly please thee; both in this present life; and Eternally. Amen.

Wound ô most sweet Lord IESUS my hart with thy Sacred Wounds; and inebriate it with thy precious blood, that whersoeuer I turne my selfe, I may alwayes see thee crucifyed aboue mee; and whatsoeuer I behold may seeme to mee red with thy sacred blood; that so wholly tending towards thee; I may be able to behold nothing besides thee; who liuest and raignest world without End. Amen.

div.head: PRAYERS TO BEE sayd in the Agony of death, or at any other time, to obtaine mercy at that hower.

p.hi: Kyrie eleison. Christe eleison. Kyrie eleison. Domine miserere nostri. Pater noster. Ave Maria.

div.p: O Saviour of the world Saue vs, who by thy Crosse & by thy blood hast redeemed vs, help vs wee beseech thee our God.

div.head: The first Prayer.
div.p: O Most sweet Lord IESUS Christ by thy agony & most holy prayer which thou mad'st for vs in the mount Olivet, when thy sweat became like drops of blood runing downe vpon the earth: I beseech thee to offer to God the Father Almighty the multitude of thy bloody sweet, which thou most copiously powredst out for the horrour of death, against the multitude of my Sinnes; & deliuer mee in the hour of my death from all paynes and anguishes, which I feare I haue deserued, for my offences; who vvith the Fa • her & holy Ghost liuest and reignest world without end. Amen.

p.hi: Kyrie eleison. Christe eleison. Kyrie eleison. Domine miserere nostri. Pater noster. Ave Maria.

div.p: Sanctifie vs ô Lord with the signe of the holy Crosse, that it may bee to vs a defence against the cruell darts of our enemyes. Defēd vs, ô Lord, by thy holy signe, & by the price of thy most pretious blood, wherewith thou hast redeemed vs.

div.head: The second Prayer.
div.p:
O Most sweet Lord IESUS Christ who vouchsafedst to dye for vs vpon the Crosse: I beseech thee to offer to God the Father Allmighty all the bitternesse of all thy suffrings which thou sustainedst for vs Sinners on the Crosse, when
thy most holy soul went out of thy most precious body, for my infirme soule: & deliver mee on the day of my death from all the paynes & suffrings which by my Sinnes I feare I haue deserved, who livest & reignest world without end. Amen.

p.hi: Kyrie eleison. Christe eleison. Kyrie eleison. Domine miserere nostri. Pater noster. Ave Maria.

div.p: Protect, & save, blesse, & sanctifie ô Lord all thy people, & turne away from mee thy servant by the signe of the holy Crosse, the diseases of my minde & body, that against this signe no danger may bee feared.

div.head: The third Prayer.
div.p:
O Most sweet Lord IESUS Christ, who hast sayd by the mouth of thy Prophet: in perpetuall charitie have I loved thee, therefore have I drawn thee vnto mee, taking pitty on thee: I beseech thee by that charitie of thine which drew thee from heaven to earth to the enduring of all thy suffrings, that thou wilt vouchsafe to offer & represent all thy paynes, & dolours to God the Father Allmightie, against all the paynes, & suffrings which by my sinnes I feare I haue deserved: save my soule in the hour of its departure: open to it the gate of life: & let mee reioyce with the Saints in glory: who livest & reignest with God the Father
in vnitie of the Holy Ghost, one God for ever & ever. Amen.

div.head: An other Prayer.
div.p:
O Most sweet Lord IESUS Christ, who hast redeemed vs with thy pretious blood, write in my soule with that thy pretious blood, all thy Wounds: and let mee learne to read in them thy dolours & love; thy dolours against all the dolours, anguishes & paynes, which for my sinnes, I feare I have deserved: thy love, that I may live to thee with an inviolable love, to the end I may not bee seperated from thee, & all thy Saints & elect for ever: Make mee, most sweet Lord partaker of thy most holy Incarnation, Passion,
Resurrection, & Ascension: make mee partaker of all the blessings, graces, merits & ioyes of all thy elect, who have pleased th • e from the beginning of the world, & grant that with all these I may reioyce in thy sight for ever. Amen.
